description: From Middle French uberté, from Latin ūbertās, from ūber.

entries.meaning: (now rare) Fertile growth, abundance, fruitfulness; copiousness, plenty.
examples: 'And yiff a tre with frut be ovirlade'/In his epistles he seith, as ye may see,/'Both braunche and bough wol enclyne and fade,/And greyne oppressith to moche vberte:/Right so it farith of fals felicite,/That of his weighte mesure doth exceede/Than of a fal gretly is to dreede'.
